shortlist.name: State Of Madness
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in peak form, having won last time out and showing consistent recent efforts. The odds reflect clear market confidence and the form profile is superior to rivals. Connections are in good order and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Fai Fai
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with solid recent form and holding value as the main threat to the favourite. Has been running well in similar company and is reliable for another strong showing.

shortlist.name: Perola (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong favourite with recent second place finish. Richard Hughes yard in form. Clear class advantage on odds assessment. Short price reflects market confidence in debut winner stepping up.

shortlist.name: Boss Lady (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two seconds and a fourth. Proven form at this level. Represents each-way value against short-priced favourite with genuine winning chance if Perola underperforms.

shortlist.name: Only In Manila
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 2.86 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent runner-up effort signals peak form; top connections with Crisford team and experienced jockey. Odds reflect strong confidence and value for a likely winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Magical Merlot
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with placed efforts, trained by Ed Dunlop who excels with progressive types. Odds offer fair value for a runner with proven reliability and scope for further improvement.

shortlist.name: Joycean Way
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with consecutive placed efforts (2252). Market leader with proven consistency at this level. Trainer Moore in good form and Watson is an experienced pilot. Represents solid value as favourite with place prospects minimized by competitive field.

shortlist.name: Lunanova
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form including two wins from four starts (1131). Won two races ago and followed up with another victory three runs back. Current form cycle suggests horse remains competitive despite mid-priced odds. Strong each-way proposition.

shortlist.name: Tenbob Tommy
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form pattern showing regular placed efforts (23562). Second last time out indicates current sharpness. Mid-range odds suggest market respects recent performances. Represents value in competitive handicap.

shortlist.name: Birthday Angel (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows a clear upward trajectory, culminating in a win last time out. The horse is clearly in form and not needing major improvement. The odds are fair for a horse with proven recent ability and a winning habit. Connections are solid for this level.

shortlist.name: Shabu Shabu (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with multiple placed efforts and a recent win. The horse is proven at this level and the trainer/jockey combination is strong. Odds represent decent value for a horse with solid recent performances and no obvious negatives.

shortlist.name: Galactic Glow (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Form figures include multiple wins and places, suggesting the horse is capable and competitive. The current odds are generous for a horse with this profile, and the jockey is experienced. Worth considering for value, though slightly less consistent than the top two.

shortlist.name: Starsong (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a mix of wins and places, indicating a strong contender.

shortlist.name: A Pint Of Bear (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent improvement in form, showing potential for a strong finish.

shortlist.name: Oh So Audacious
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form figures suggest a strong contender, though recent races have been mixed.

shortlist.name: Alshimali (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with solid recent form showing third place finish. Tony Carroll stable runner with experienced jockey William Carson. Recent form figures of 3-1-8 indicate consistency at this level. Odds suggest strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Antiphon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with back-to-back third place finishes (33). Well-backed in market at 4/1 suggesting yard confidence. Mike Murphy runner showing consistent improvement and placed efforts recently.

shortlist.name: Juno Star (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Remarkably consistent form figures of 3-3-3-3-8 demonstrating reliability at this level. Sean Levey is a top-class jockey booking. Recent placed efforts show horse is competitive and knocking on the door for a win.

shortlist.name: Victors Dream
shortlist.rationale: Course winner with form figures showing a win (1) and recent second place (2). Marco Botti-trained runner offers value at 9/1 given recent placed efforts. Exchange odds of 4.6 suggest stronger chances than bookmaker price indicates.

shortlist.name: Bel Amigo (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is strong, with three consecutive wins last season and a respectable seasonal return. Connections are reliable, and current odds reflect market confidence. No signs of decline in form, making this runner the most solid on both form and value.

shortlist.name: King Ulanda (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings and a win last season. Connections are in good form, and odds indicate strong market support. Recent runs suggest the horse is holding form well and does not require major improvement.

shortlist.name: V Twelve (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability with several placings and a win in the past. Recent form is competitive, and odds are fair for a runner with proven consistency. Connections are capable, and the horse fits the profile of a likely contender without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Tellherthename (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with multiple placed efforts, including a recent win and a close second. Top connections and a leading jockey. Odds are short but justified by proven ability and reliability.

shortlist.name: Push The Button (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed efforts show ability, though form is less consistent than the favourite. Trainer and jockey are solid, and current odds offer some value if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Cave Bridge (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong market support and competitive odds suggest a well-regarded contender, though form details are not provided.

shortlist.name: Ryebridge (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows some consistency, and the odds reflect a strong chance of winning.

shortlist.name: Driver's Pick (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lack of form details, but odds suggest a contender. Trainer and jockey combination is experienced.

shortlist.name: Almazhar Garde (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is strong with three wins in last four starts, including a victory last time out. The horse is clearly in form and has shown the ability to win under pressure. The odds are fair for a horse with this level of consistency and upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Your Own Story (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placed efforts, including a recent second. The stable is in good form and the horse has shown it can compete at this level. The exchange odds offer some value given the connections and recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Dare To Shout
shortlist.rationale: Extremely consistent with a string of placed efforts, suggesting the horse is knocking on the door for a win. While not always finding the line first, the form figures indicate reliability and the odds are attractive for a horse with this level of consistency.

shortlist.name: Looking Splendid
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 3.85 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a win last time, showing clear improvement and race fitness. Consistent prior form, including multiple placings, suggests reliability at this level. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters. No need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Born In The West (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6 exchange (solid second-favorite, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile with multiple recent placings and wins, indicating strong current form. Proven ability to compete at this level and stays the trip well. Connections are reliable and the horse is holding form, making this runner a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Hello Judge
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two places from last three starts. Trainer and jockey have a solid strike rate together. Odds represent fair value for a horse in form and with proven connections.

shortlist.name: Alshadhian (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two seconds in last three runs, suggesting he is hitting peak form. Trainer is in good form and the horse is clearly improving. Odds slightly drift on exchanges but still represent value for a horse on the up.

shortlist.name: Busty Boy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Extremely consistent with five consecutive places, including two wins. The form string (2222) is a classic sign of a horse knocking on the door, though the drift on exchanges suggests some caution. Still, hard to ignore given reliability.

shortlist.name: Noble Journey
shortlist.rationale: Strong connections with top trainer and jockey, solid recent form (4th in debut, likely to improve), and dominant market support. Appleby/Buick combo excels with unexposed types at this venue. No major improvement needed; expected to progress naturally.

shortlist.name: American Flight (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong connections with Boughey/Loughnane, recent form includes a close third and a fourth at this level, and odds indicate market confidence. No signs of decline and likely to be suited by conditions.

shortlist.name: Mad Unicorn
shortlist.rationale: Recent win signals peak form, Balding yard is in good order, and odds are competitive for a progressive runner. Has shown improvement and consistency in last two starts.

shortlist.name: Don Pacifico (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win this season; trained by the in-form Crisford team and partnered by reliable jockey Jack Mitchell. Current odds reflect strong market support and suggest he is the most likely winner based on both form and connections.

shortlist.name: Hello Zaman (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and several competitive finishes indicate reliable form. Trainer James Tate is respected at this venue, and Rossa Ryan is a strong booking. Odds are competitive and suggest genuine winning claims without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Evening Saigon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive form with recent 1st-3rd-2nd sequence showing consistency at this level. James Doyle booking is significant with strong strike rate. Short, solid recent form indicates horse is race-fit and in current form without needing improvement. Odds reflect market confidence in ability to deliver.

shortlist.name: Mesaafi
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with 2nd-1st placings showing current fitness and ability. Consistent finishes in frame (2-1-1-9) suggest horse is competitive at this grade. Mitchell rides with good course knowledge. Fair odds for solid each-way proposition with proven form.

shortlist.name: Charlie Mason
shortlist.rationale: Significant value discrepancy between bookmaker and exchange odds suggests smart money. Form shows consistent recent placings (2-1-4) with improvement pattern. Ryan's booking adds weight. Exchange odds of 3.7 makes this legitimate contender being underestimated by traditional bookmakers.

shortlist.name: Kitaro Kich (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win last time out, showing clear improvement and peak fitness. Reliable jockey and trainer combination. Recent form suggests the horse is at its best and well-suited to current conditions. Odds reflect strong market support and value for a likely winner.

shortlist.name: Giant
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple places and a win in last six runs. Connections are respected at this level. Odds offer reasonable value for a horse with proven reliability and fitness. Should be competitive based on recent performances.

shortlist.name: Mister Mojito (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and several competitive efforts. Jockey and trainer have delivered results at this track. Odds indicate market respect and suggest the horse is expected to run well. No major improvement needed to contend.

shortlist.name: Valadero (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.8 exchange (solid market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple runner-up finishes, indicating reliability and readiness to win. Connections are competent, and odds reflect genuine market respect. No major improvement needed, just a repeat of recent efforts should suffice.

shortlist.name: My Mate Beattie (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent second-place finish signals return to form. Top jockey booking (De Sousa) and respected trainer add confidence. Odds are competitive and suggest market expects a strong run. No major improvement required, just needs to maintain recent level.

shortlist.name: Morte Point
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two seconds in last three starts, indicating peak condition. Top connections for this level and strong market support confirm expectations. No sign of regression in form cycle.

shortlist.name: The Quiet Gent (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has been running consistently in competitive company, placing multiple times this season. Trainer and jockey are both in strong form. Recent efforts suggest he remains competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: My Boy Harry
shortlist.odds_note: 6/4 SBK, 2.64 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win last time out and multiple placings, indicating peak fitness and reliability. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and suitability for this grade. Connections are in form and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Cuban Fiesta
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 3.85 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability to win at this level and placed recently. While last two runs were below best, overall profile is competitive for this field and odds offer value relative to main rival. Jockey booking is positive.

shortlist.name: Kessaar Power (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 4.4 exchange (third in market, holding form)

shortlist.name: Wyld Bill

shortlist.name: Masqool (Ire)

shortlist.name: Voix De Bocelli
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form pattern with multiple placings (2-1-3-1). Elite jockey booking in Hollie Doyle suggests connections expect strong performance. Recent form shows ability to compete at this level. Each-way value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Captain Parma (Ire)

shortlist.name: We're Goosers (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up on debut, showing immediate ability and likely improvement. Hugo Palmer is a reliable trainer, and Harry Davies is a capable jockey. The horse is fit, in form, and well-supported in the market, indicating strong confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: King's Trust
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with a 4th and 3rd, suggesting progression and readiness. Trained by the top Gosden team and ridden by experienced Robert Havlin. The odds reflect genuine market respect, and the horse does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Rogue Citation (Ire)

shortlist.name: Bushwacker (Ire)

shortlist.name: Starlit City (Ire)

shortlist.name: Purple Rainbow

shortlist.name: Summer Heat
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile with multiple placings and a recent second, suggesting reliability and readiness. Trained by a top yard and partnered with a capable jockey. Form is progressive and competitive for this grade.

shortlist.name: Fire Eyes (Fr)

shortlist.name: Belaya River (Fr)

shortlist.name: Betelgeuse (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid mid-range odds and recent form includes several competitive finishes in similar company. Has shown ability to stay on and compete for places, with no major drop-off in performance. Connections are capable and the horse is holding form.

shortlist.name: Hickton (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with multiple placings (3rd, 2nd, 3rd, 1st) showing consistency at this level. Latest run shows solid performance and connections suggest horse is in good current form. Market leader at competitive odds reflects genuine winning chance.

shortlist.name: Neo King (Fr)

shortlist.name: Radharc Na Slaine (Ire)

shortlist.name: In My Teens (Ire)

shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two seconds in last four starts. Trainer has a strong record, and the horse is proven over the trip. Exchange odds offer value for a horse in form.

shortlist.name: Run For Mahler (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form showing consistency with three placings in last five starts including two seconds. Strong trainer-jockey combination. Market leader reflects genuine winning chance at short odds.

shortlist.name: Qualimita (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Gordon Elliott-trained runner with solid form profile showing multiple placed efforts. Consistent performer in competitive company. Second choice in betting suggests market respect for yard's prowess.

shortlist.name: Cailin Deas (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win (1) shows return to form after inconsistent middle-distance runs. Each-way value at current odds with proven ability to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Tassarolo
shortlist.rationale: Progressive recent form with a win and placed efforts in last three starts, suggesting peak fitness. Trainer Denis Hogan is in good form and the odds indicate strong market support. No signs of decline and connections are reliable.

shortlist.name: Lambay Island (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple fourth-place finishes, indicating reliability and potential to improve. Trained by Henry de Bromhead, a top yard, and jockey booking is positive. Market odds suggest genuine contender status.

shortlist.name: Tatateo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes two wins and a second, showing ability and consistency at this level. Trainer/jockey combination is proven, and odds reflect realistic winning chance. No major improvement needed.

shortlist.name: Additional Time (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form and competitive odds make it a top contender.

shortlist.name: Heron's Butler (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows potential despite the unplaced finish, and odds are favorable.

shortlist.name: Tsavo Park (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form indicates some consistency, and odds offer good value for a potential upset.

shortlist.name: Hewick (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form figures, including several placed efforts, suggest a horse knocking on the door for a win. The Hanlon yard is in good form, and the jockey-trainer combination is reliable. The odds are short but reflect genuine chance; this horse does not need major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Run For Oscar (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and two seconds, indicating current sharpness. The Byrnes stable is respected, and the horse is proven at this level. The odds offer better value than the favorite, and the horse is in the right form to challenge without needing to step up significantly.

shortlist.name: Sallap (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows a clear upward trajectory, culminating in a win last time out. The trainer and jockey are reliable, and the odds offer value for a horse that is clearly in form and not needing major improvement[1][3].

shortlist.name: Siul Molly Siul (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in recent starts, with a second and a sixth in last two runs. The jockey and trainer are experienced, and the odds are fair for a horse that is knocking on the door and not out of its depth[1][3].

shortlist.name: Milanaway (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability to place at this level, with a string of seconds and thirds earlier in the season. The trainer is capable, and the exchange odds are generous for a horse that could outrun its price if bouncing back to earlier form[1][3].

shortlist.name: Mme Huntress (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear favourite at 1.24 exchange; very strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with M/M de Kock, a leading trainer in South Africa. Recent fourth-place finish suggests solid form and likely improvement. The odds indicate strong confidence from the market, and the horse does not require major improvement to win in this field.

shortlist.name: Master's Lady (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice at 2.08 exchange; well respected.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a third and fifth followed by a second, indicating reliability and readiness. Muzi Yeni is a capable jockey, and the odds reflect genuine winning potential. Connections are solid and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Trajanus (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent second-place finishes, strong trainer and jockey combination.

shortlist.name: Hammer Blow (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent third-place finish indicates potential, decent odds value.

shortlist.name: Onetwobucklemyshoe (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Clear standout on recent form, finishing second last time out and now dropping in class. The odds are short but reflect genuine superiority in this field. No need for improvement—already proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Arizona Magic (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form in recent starts, finishing fourth and fifth in stronger races. The step down in class and current odds offer value for a horse with solid connections and proven ability.

shortlist.name: War Summit (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent efforts, placing in three of last four starts. Trainer and jockey are reliable, and the horse is proven at this level. Odds are fair for a horse that is knocking on the door.

shortlist.name: Saragossa Cat (Arg)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.41 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a second from two starts, indicating rapid improvement and reliability. Trained by a leading yard and partnered by a top jockey. The short odds reflect strong market confidence and align with the horse's current form and connections.

shortlist.name: Blushing Bloom (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, including a win and a second in last two starts, for the same top stable as the favorite. The combination of solid form, proven ability to win, and strong connections makes this runner a logical contender. Odds suggest clear respect from the market.

shortlist.name: Potberrie (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Current exchange odds 2.12, clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Potberrie arrives in peak form, winning last time out and showing consistent top-four finishes. The odds indicate strong market confidence, and the trainer is respected locally. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: King's Express (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: King's Express has won twice in last five starts and scored last time out, indicating solid current form. Trainer Habib is reliable, and the odds reflect strong support. No major improvement needed.

shortlist.name: Lady Fallon (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Lady Fallon boasts a string of wins before a seasonal break and has returned with two fair efforts. Connections are strong, and odds suggest she is expected to be competitive. Recent form is solid, not requiring major improvement.

shortlist.name: Soho Heartthrob (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.51 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win in last five starts. Top jockey booking and strong market support indicate high confidence from connections and punters. No sign of declining form and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Obsidian (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form, winning last three starts and four of last five. Top connections and proven ability to win repeatedly at this level. Odds reflect strong chance and current peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Last Car To Pass (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Third in market at 3.05 on exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with several recent placings and a win two starts back. Remains competitive at this level and market respect suggests another bold showing is expected.

shortlist.name: Michael Faraday (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Comes off a win last time out, indicating peak form. Connections are solid and the price reflects strong market confidence. Recent improvement and proven ability to win at this level make him the standout.

shortlist.name: Calida (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with reliable recent form, including a close second last time. Jockey/trainer combo is respected locally. Has not needed major improvement and is well-supported in the market.
